@graph.title: Searching for Sebald : photography after W. G. Sebald
@graph.abstract: Introduction : searching for Sebald : what I know for sure / Lise Patt -- Notes on how to read this book -- Intermezzo : Vertigo -- "But the written word is not a true document" : a conversation with W.G. Sebald on literature and photography / Christian Scholz -- How to understand the light on a landscape / Pablo Helguera -- The colorful auras discovered in old black-and-white negative glass plates of one family photographed at the same location / Skúta -- Picturing place : travel, photography, and imaginative geography in W.G. Sebald's Rings of Saturn / Christina Kraenzle -- Who is Reinhold Hahn? / Tris Vonna-Michell -- True fictions and fictional truths : the enigmatic in Sebald's use of images in The emigrants / Florence Feiereisen & Daniel Pope -- Birdland / Chris Rochelle -- Excerpt from Gray index / Helen Mirra -- Intermezzo : The emigrants -- Photographs, images, and the space of literature in Sebald's prose / John Sears -- Theorizing cinema in Sebald and Sebald with cinema / Mattias Frey -- The Minimalls of Downey, California / Matthew T. Marco -- Sebald's tree : the development of a 90% true digital story / Tim Wright -- Gathering evidence of ghosts : W.G. Sebald's practices of witnessing / Lisa Diedrich -- Melancholy longings : Sebald, Benjamin, and the image of Kafka / Markus Zisselsberger -- Sebald's invisible cities / Anne Flannery -- "Donner à voir" : the logics of the caption in W.G. Sebald's Rings of Saturn and Alexander Kluge's Devil's blind spot / Adrian Daub -- All that is beyond hearing : a life of Arturo Ott / Antoinette LaFarge -- Intermezzo : The rings of Saturn -- Felix Gonzalez-Torres : the jigsaw puzzles / Deborah Cullen -- Hand in glove : negative indexicality in André Breton's Nadja and W.G. Sebald's Austerlitz / Anneleen Masschelein -- Itinerary for a walking tour through East Anglia / Christel Dillbohner -- Superimposition as a narrative strategy in Austerlitz / Bettina Mosbach -- Post-war Germany and "objective chance" : W.G. Sebald, Joseph Beuys, and Tacita Dean / Christa-Maria Lerm Hayes -- Translation and repetition : an architectural translation of W.G. Sebald's The rings of Saturn / Daniel Lash -- "Quel roman!" : Sebald, Barthes, and the pursuit of the mother-image / Avi Kempinski -- Going nowhere : Sebald's Rhizomatic travels / Carsten Strathausen -- A truth that lies elsewhere / ICI Research Team -- Intermezzo : Austerlitz -- Max / Axel Forrester -- Photographs / Shimon Attie -- Memorial sights/sites : Sebald, photography, and the art of autobiogeography in The emigrants / Christopher C. Gregory-Guider -- Pictures remain and live : remembering W.G. Sebald : W.G. Sebald in portrait photo portfolio / Christian Scholz -- Antarctica / Dorothy Cross -- German suffering or "narrative fetishism?" : W.G. Sebald's "Air war and literature : Zürich lectures" / Richard Crownshaw -- Trying to remember my mother's face / Suvan Geer -- History series / Adam Pendleton -- A firework for W.G. Sebald (2005-06) / Jeremy Millar.
